summary:
Worldwide global regulatory support through cross-functional interactions with manufacturing, brand and therapeutic area teams for biotechnology products within the company's portfolio. Regulatory strategic planning, authoring of regulatory submissions (CMC), coordination of work by SMEs and production facility teams in multitasking environment to ensure timely completion of regulatory documentation. Professional analytical data monitoring, assessment of change controls and deviations, identifying risks with appropriate contingency strategies. Leading regulatory filing strategies and guiding product development on different phases - Ph 1-3 clinical to BLA/MAA. Knowledge of Technology Transfer and IP tools. 
•	Experience in global GXPs related to pharmaceutical quality of biologics throughout the product lifecycle: from pre-IND to post-approval. As an ex-FDA employee deep understanding of FDA 21st Century Managed Review Process, professional knowledge of the laws, guidances and regulations (FDA, EMA). Prooven records of Product Quality (CMC) Review of original BLAs, INDs, pre-BLA packages, Drug Master Files. 
•	Active participation in FDA Pre-License and Pre-Approval Inspections of biotech facilities in the frame of BLA and PAS approval process. Deep knowledge of FDA/EMA requirements for compliance and quality documentation within manufacturing facility. Extensive experience in review of drugs filled into pre-filled syringes, deep involvement into interdisciplinary review of Combination Products with Center for Devices and Radiological Health (U.S. FDA). 
•	Exceptional oral and written communication skills: presentations at FDA internal regulatory and  international scientific meetings, writing of professional review reports, 15 scientific articles as a lead author. Proficient and creative analyst and presenter of complex technical information to diverse audiences. Inter-agency (FDA-NIH-CDC) and scientific international collaborative research experience (in US, Germany and Russia). Good professional network. FDA CBER Leveraging Collaboration Award 
•	Highly experienced and recognized biomedical scientist with a focus on stem cells biology, proteomics; molecular diagnostics, biochemistry and genetics of mammalian viruses, immunology and anti-viral vaccine development. Extensive experience in proteomics and Mass Spectrometry, biology of human embryonic stem cells (hESC) and human induced pluripotent stem cells (hiPSCs).

publications.description: Induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSC)-based technologies are now being progressed toward clinical use, such as cell therapy-based medicinal products. This has created a need for approaches to monitor the quality of human induced pluripotent stem cells (hiPSCs) during their large-scale production. We applied comparative proteomics to identify changes in cellular proteomes during cell culturing and subsequent differentiation into embryoid bodies (EBs) between normally grown (control) hiPSCs and “overgrown” hiPSCs.
publications.name: Proteomic Approach for Creation of the Protein Marker Panels to Control the Quality of Human iPCS

commentary.text: Wow ! 1st author at Nature Communications is definitely a great achievement!!! Congratulations Chao!
